c74object.name: ears.collect~
c74object.description: Create buffers by collecting individual samples.

outlet.description: Sends a bang to output collected data
Incoming samples to be collected (one inlet for each buffer channel)
Sample index is optional; if not set, an auto-counting mechanism is put in place

objarg.name: numbuffers
objarg.description: Sets the number of buffers to be collected in parallel.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang in the leftmost inlet causes the collected buffers to be output

method.name: clear
method.description: The clear message sets all the samples of the buffers to be collected to 0.

method.name: float/list
method.description: A float or a list in the middle inlets causes the corresponding samples to be collected (one sample for each channel)

method.name: int
method.description: An integer in the rightmost inlet sets the sample index. This is not strictly needed, as an auto-increment system is in place by default, but may be useful in situations where the sample collection is not linear

method.name: reset
method.description: The reset message only resets the sample counting (restarting from 0), not clearing the existing buffers

attribute.name: autoclear
keepmemory
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to keep the allocated memory while clearing. This means that filling in new buffers will be faster. Set this to zero if you want to have more free RAM.

attribute.name: mode
sr
attribute.description: Sets the sample rate for the output buffer. If zero (default) then the current Max sample rate is used.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (bang)
entry.description: Bang to Output Data. Sends a bang to output collected data

entry.name: Outlets 2, 3, 4... (int/list)
entry.description: Samples. Incoming samples to be collected (one inlet for each buffer channel)

entry.name: The last Outlet (int)
entry.description: Sample Index. Sample index is optional; if not set, an auto-counting mechanism is put in place
